elements.title: Red Rock sunflower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the newly discovered and critically imperiled Red Rock sunflower (Helianthus devernii) has only been found around two desert springs located in the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area?

elements.title: Julian Lewis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that football player Julian Lewis received offers to play college football before he had attended high school?

elements.title: a historic villa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that carpenter Cumming Haswell erected a historic villa, later described as "modestly-scaled but ornamental"?

elements.title: Terry Pratchett's earliest Discworld stories (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Terry Pratchett's earliest Discworld stories were posthumously found and published by two of his fans?

elements.title: Joan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the flaming finale of Joan by Alexander McQueen has been read as an image of violence, resilience, transcendence, and resurrection?

elements.title: South by South Lawn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2016 festival South by South Lawn included a panel discussion on climate change led by President Obama?

elements.title: Melani Budianta (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Melani Budianta used street gangs and Moonies in Los Angeles to reflect on the state of democracy in Indonesia?

elements.title: Stardust's only song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stardust's only song earned them a $3 million offer from a record label, but they refused?

elements.title: Bill Wurtz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bill Wurtz once accepted an award with a two-word acceptance speech?
